column4: Yeah, but I have my prior OS disc.
So I just need to insert that and I can install.
Cogito, yeah, it's an upgrade disc, but if I can insert my prior OS disc, it'll install fine.
Works the same as a regular install.
how do you mean no swap?
id theoretically have to use two ISOs, regardless

Cogito, I am currently running Ubuntu 10.04. I have one CD drive. I have installed VirtualBox and am attempting to install Windows XP Professional. Because I own an upgrade disc, during installation, I must insert my prior OS disc (I own a Windows 98 full install disc) to continue. I cannot eject my CD drive to replace the XP disc with the 98 disc so I cannot continue with the installation.
How do I eject the drive so that I can swap the discs, Cogito?
Cogito, how would I go about converting my 98 disc into an ISO?
you should be able to unmount the disk in said menu
presumably not while the installation is running. Besides, I attempted that and it would not unmount.
you should be able to mount a second disk, perhaps you have 2 drives and windows accepts the disk on another drive. If that will not work, I doubt making ISOs will help
you should be able to unmount, as far as the drive is not in use, and since you are asked to insert another disk, it's quite weird
